intro: Kellochloa, commonly known as the silky grass or silky sedges, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. These plants are typically found in wet or moist environments, such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of streams. They are characterized by their slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets. Kellochloa species often form dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization in wetland habitats. Their presence is an indicator of healthy, undisturbed aquatic or semi-aquatic ecosystems.
